summary: The golden age of vaccine development (32 minute read) Vaccine technology has changed inconceivably in the 230 years since the accidental discovery of the first vaccine. With progress speeding up in recent years, the golden age of vaccine development seems imminent.

title: The Modern AI PM in the age of Agents
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-08, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FFGzE56/1/0100019b9d5a9e43-9c61a285-189b-471a-98e0-8e84f66d8626-000000/SBmsQc5ju6sYKu4KBfbiy_E5ZSJqZ4IghVHVvLgf_so=439
summary: The Modern AI PM in the age of Agents (10 minute read) The job of the PM used to be to translate what customers want into specs that would be handed to engineers. That translation layer is compressing. PMs are now writing specs for AI agents to implement. The bottleneck has shifted upstream as the implementation barrier has dropped. The scarce resource is now knowing what's actually worth building.

title: AI's impact on Tailwind
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-08, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fsimonwillison.net%2F2026%2FJan%2F7%2Fadam-wathan%2F%23atom-everything%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019b9d5a9e43-9c61a285-189b-471a-98e0-8e84f66d8626-000000/NRhgSn4yhHwiRqKFrll-6vYKOBkGl9HLbu1ER8tGAus=439
summary: AI's impact on Tailwind (2 minute read) 75% of Tailwind's engineering team lost their jobs due to the impact AI has had on the business. While Tailwind is growing faster than ever and is bigger than it has ever been, its revenue is down close to 80%.

title: LMArena is a cancer on AI

summary: LMArena is a cancer on AI (5 minute read) LMArena is a popular online AI leaderboard that is a broken system for evaluating AI models. The platform rewards superficial qualities like verbosity, aggressive formatting, and emojis over factual accuracy because users quickly vote based on aesthetics rather than careful evaluation. These wrong incentives lead models to optimize for "hallucination-plus-formatting."

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-09, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fthreadreaderapp.com%2Fthread%2F2002830967426207967.html%3Futm_source=tldrmarketing/1/0100019ba2a6c2e2-c0954226-82d4-481f-8cc5-722f487d801c-000000/xniuRdqrXgaQpLXIGK_3AFUKKQ-8_qlBtRehEJmTLfo=439
summary: How to convert free users into paying subscribers (2 minute read) Apps should combine a free install with onboarding that highlights user pain points, shows the solution, and provides social proof. This filters out less serious users, while soft paywalls let interest fade and reduce sign-ups.

title: AI & Humans: Making the Relationship Work

summary: AI & Humans: Making the Relationship Work (15 minute read) Agentic AI, especially in collaborative groups, often has human-like behaviors, which means traditional human management principles are surprisingly relevant. summary: Kubernetes v1.35: A Better Way to Pass Service Account Tokens to CSI Drivers (4 minute read) Kubernetes v1.35 introduces a beta opt-in solution for CSI drivers, enabling them to securely receive service account tokens through the `secrets` field in `NodePublishVolumeRequest` instead of the less secure `volume_context`. title: PostgreSQL 18 RETURNING Enhancements: A Game Changer for Modern Applications
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-09, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.pgedge.com%2Fblog%2Fpostgresql-18-returning-enhancements-a-game-changer-for-modern-applications%3Futm_source=tldrdevops/1/0100019ba2bbec84-228ee830-5bd9-4d80-98c9-dcb27717b525-000000/KsuEsqjzNXrcSjtCzpi-lJcA0jKq8tYj_6XH01Yez0M=439
summary: PostgreSQL 18 RETURNING Enhancements: A Game Changer for Modern Applications (7 minute read) PostgreSQL 18 significantly enhances the RETURNING clause by introducing OLD and NEW aliases across INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, and MERGE, enabling developers to access before-and-after row values in a single atomic statement. This removes the need for triggers or extra queries, simplifies change tracking and auditing, and makes MERGE-based upserts far more powerful and maintainable.

summary: Apache Hudi 1.1 Deep Dive: Async Instant Time Generation for Flink Writers (11 minute read) Apache Hudi 1.1 introduces asynchronous instant time generation for Flink writers, allowing them to request and receive a new instant time before the previous instant is fully committed, eliminating blocking delays that previously caused throughput fluctuations, backpressure, and ingestion instability during the gap between data flushing and checkpoint completion.

title: Data Trust is Death by a Thousand Paper Cuts
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-12, Reading time: 8 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.rudderstack.com%2Fblog%2Fdata-trust-clickstream-discrepancy%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdata/1/0100019bb1e484b2-546bfbe4-1777-42e9-b4e4-c9705f55b88f-000000/_P_i93v8e_QJjCqosjjs10UxyNI_bO-hgRppoCxT_mk=439
summary: Data Trust is Death by a Thousand Paper Cuts (8 minute read) Small, accumulating failures across the clickstream data lifecycle, such as instrumentation drift, unvalidated developer changes, bot traffic inflation, ad-blocker suppression, pipeline downtime, and misconfigurations, can create significant discrepancies (e.g., 18% fewer sign-ups in analytics vs. backend database) that erode overall data trust, leading to unreliable analytics, delayed decisions, and risks for AI models.

title: std::move doesn't move anything: A deep dive into Value Categories
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-12, Reading time: 38 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2F0xghost.dev%2Fblog%2Fstd-move-deep-dive%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019bb2300f73-ceac9e06-172d-4e15-a195-2b7ea602b7fd-000000/BpMGqHaAvADu3fY9V8M3yWVhaARu-rIVXctTxZuJ8Po=439
summary: std::move doesn't move anything: A deep dive into Value Categories (38 minute read) `std::move` in C++ is a misnamed function that doesn't physically move data, but rather casts an expression into an rvalue reference, signaling that its resources can be "pillaged." This conversion allows move constructors and move assignment operators to efficiently transfer ownership of resources, usually by swapping pointers, instead of performing expensive deep copies.

summary: Use multiple models (7 minute read) Problems with AI models can often be solved by passing the same query to a peer model. title: In AI Agents, Traces Are the Source of Truth
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-12, Reading time: 4 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FkoX9un/1/0100019bb2929d00-5450a88f-f102-4d41-bf69-569bf986d5f3-000000/QFzo6aRnbifIrxxjUIoJSSoplIJ7jHJhumnM5aBxvZo=439
summary: In AI Agents, Traces Are the Source of Truth (4 minute read) In AI agents, the code only orchestrates models and tools, while real decision-making happens inside the model at runtime and cannot be understood by reading the code alone. summary: Rain's valuation jumps to $1.95bn as stablecoin funding accelerates (2 minute read) Stablecoin infrastructure firm Rain raised $250 million in a Series C led by ICONIQ that values the company at $1.95 billion, as regulatory tailwinds and institutional interest fuel crypto adoption. The company plans to use the capital to expand into licensed markets and scale its stablecoin-linked cards and payments platform, which already supports transactions wherever Visa is accepted.
